meanings.definition: The quality of being unchanging or unwavering.
meanings.sent1: Her constancy in always arriving on time made her a trusted employee.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse's constancy in guiding ships through the stormy night was commendable.
meanings.sent3: The clock's constancy in ticking without pause amused the curious child.
meanings.sent4: The mountain's constancy in standing tall through all seasons was a symbol of strength.
meanings.sent5: The river's constancy in flowing steadily reminded him of the passage of time.

meanings.definition: The quality of being reliable or dependable.
meanings.sent1: His constancy in keeping his promises earned him the trust of his friends.
meanings.sent2: The old watch's constancy in keeping accurate time surprised its owner.
meanings.sent3: The dog's constancy in fetching the ball back delighted the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent4: The oak tree's constancy in providing shade year after year was a comfort to the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The car's constancy in starting up without fail was a relief during the cold winter mornings.
